description: Borrowed from Latin rēctō foliō (“on the right leaf, on the right page”), the ablative case of the Latin rēctus (“right”). Compare versus (“turned”).

entries.meaning: The front side of a flat object which is to be examined visually, as for reading, such as a sheet, leaf, coin or medal.
(printing) The right-hand page of a book of a script which reads from left to right, usually having an odd page number.
